result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth A. Wolf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

12:59 PM Defendant Kenneth A. Wolf in court.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Kenneth A. Wolf.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Parties have rec/rev VIS.  State states the joint rec.  Atty Duren agrees and enters NC pleas.  DE also pleads NC.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Duren makes statement.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  

Ct 1:  NC
Ct 2:  NC
Ct 3:  Dismissed/read-in

DNA samples to be provided

Court states case and appearances.  Atty Duren states DE will waive his right to prelim, DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.

02:49 PM Defendant Kenneth A. Wolf in court with attorney Allison A Markoski.  Defendant Kenneth A. Wolf in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth A. Wolf appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE hasn't reached anyone at the PD's office yet but will call again after court today.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument - requests signature bond w/conditions.  Atty Markoski responds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with T.L.M. or her residenceor place of employment.  Victim may return one time to the DE's residence to collect personal belongings and her pet.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
